SUMMARY: RtcR , RNA terminal phosphate cyclase regulator, regulates expression of genes involved in ATP-dependent conversion of a 3'-phosphate at end of RNA to 2',3'-cyclic phosphodiester [9738023]. RtcR belongs to group of σ54-dependent transcriptional regulators, which contain three domains: sensory domain located in N terminus, central domain involved in ATP hydrolysis and interaction with σ54, and C-terminal domain, which contains a helix-turn-helix motif. Although C-terminal domain and central domain from RtcR are similar to those of or members of this group, its N-terminal domain is not [9738023]. rtcR gene is transcribed divergently from genes it regulates [9738023].
